# Request for Abbreviated Proposals for Surface Water and Groundwater Sampling Services

## Overview

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites qualified consulting firms to submit Abbreviated Proposals to establish a Standing Offer (SO) for the provision of professional services for surface water and groundwater sampling at various locations, including the Valcartier Garrison and other sites in the Quebec region.

## Services Required

The Consultant will provide 'as and when required' services in support of surface water, groundwater, and stormwater effluent sampling projects. These services will include laboratory analysis and equipment procurement.

## Evaluation Criteria

The Abbreviated Proposals will be evaluated based on established criteria outlined in the RFAP document. Evaluation will focus on the Consultant's experience, qualifications, and ability to deliver the required services.

## Offer Details

The Standing Offer will be for a period of one (1) year, with an estimated value of $1,000,000.00. Commissions under the Standing Offer are expected to be valued between $20,000.00 and $240,000.00. The maximum value of a commission under the Standing Offer is $375,000.00.

## Extension and Renewal Options

The Standing Offer may be extended for up to three (3) additional one (1) year periods, with possible increases in order value. The maximum total value of all commissions under the Standing Offer is $4,000,000.00.

## Tender Details

* Tender Reference Number: MX-42976774394
* Solicitation Number: VR992304
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-02-07 14:00:00
* Publication Date: 2023-12-13
* Amendment Date: 2024-02-07

## Contact Information

For more information and to submit an offer, please visit [www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com). Fees may apply; see [https://www.merx.com/public/pricing](https://www.merx.com/public/pricing) for more information. Contact Craig Patterson at 613-794-5311 or Craig.Patterson@dcc-cdc.gc.ca for inquiries.

## Notice

Bidders should confirm the tender details and requirements before submitting their offer. The RFAP document is available on the MERX website for review.
